result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry L. Passow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terry L. Passow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terry L. Passow was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L. Passow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry L. Passow in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:27 a.m. Agreement stated - plea to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and other counseling as needed, court costs, no contact with AMS (DOB 8/25/97). Victim impact statement to be read. Atty Cirilli and Def agree. Def understands charge and possible penalties. No contest plea to ct 1. Court reviews plea quest and constitutional rights. Atty Cirilli satisfied. Court accepts plea. Factual basis stipulated. Court finds guilty of ct 1. Ct 2 dismissed. Victim impact statement read. State asks agreement be followed. Statement by Atty Cirilli. Nothing by Defendant. Court accepts agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, AODA and other counseling as deemed appropriate. No contact with victim. Court costs. Postconviction rights. Def advised to report for fingerprinting within 10 days.

Defendant Terry L. Passow in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:07 am.  offer made, & waives p.h.  Atty Cirilli waives p.h.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & bind over.  Information Filed. Atty Cirilli has copy of information, waives reading & enters Not Guilty. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Continue Bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Terry L. Passow in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Bond will continue with conditions.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Review of bond.  Arguments by Atty Cirilli, to lift the no alcohol provision.  Response by State.  Court will remove the restriction.  Copy of minutes to SD.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
No use of alcohol.  No contact with AMS

Defendant Terry L. Passow in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  Def wishes to contact an atty.  State request signature bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
